bibl.title: John Bowler and Edward McCrinkle v. James H. Bennett. Exhibit A
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court for the Third Judicial District of Washington

body.p: United States of America, Territory of Washington, } ss. City of Seattle
The President of the United States of America to the Marshal of said Territory, and to the Keeper of the Jail of King County, in the Territory of Washington, Greeting:

Whereas, John Bowler has been arrested upon the aoth of James H. Bennet for having, on or about the 26th day of June A.D. 1888, at Seattle in the Territory aforesaid having duly taken an oath before C.D. Emery ( he the said C.D. Emery being then and there a United States Commissioner duly commissioned acting sworn and qualified to administer oaths) that he woud testify declare and depose truly in a certain action then and there pending before the said commissioner wherein the United States was plaintiff and he the said James H. Bennett was defendant, did then and there wilfully corruptly feloniously and contrary to such oath, wilfully under oath state and testify that he the said James H. Bennett did on the 15th. day of June A.D. 1888 at the harbor of San Francisco in the State of California, with brass knuckles, make an assault in and upon him the said John Bowler, and him the said John Bowler, with said brass knucles did then and there beat and wound, the said statement by the said John Bowler then and there testified to being then and there a material matter in and upon the said hearing and which he the said John Bowler then and there believed and knew to be untrue.

and has been examined by me, Charles D. Emery a Commissioner of the United States for said Territory of Washington, upon the aforesaid charge and the said charge appearing to be sustained and has been required to give bail in the sum of 200 Dollars for his appearance before the District Court for the 3d Judicial District of said Territory Seattle on the first day of the next regular term thereof, which requisition he has failed to comply with:

There are therefore, to Command you, In the name and by the authority aforesaid, to receive the said John Bowler prisoner of the United States of America, into your custody, to remain in confinement until he be discharged by due course of law.
Given under my hand and seal in the City and Territory aforesaid, this 27 day of June A.D. 1888
